8. Secundum Phrygas. A soloecism for the Phrygians (Cata- phrygiam) or Montanists, who are here represented as being divided on the Patripaasian question into two parties, the followers of Procius, and the followers of Aeschines. Hippolytus (Psilos. viii. 19) also mentions this schism. On Montanus and his heresy see Salmon in D. 0. Β. iii. 935 ff., and the references there given.
